newsitem.title: FRANCE: Spanish foreign minister arrives in Algiers.
newsitem.headline: Spanish foreign minister arrives in Algiers.

text.p: Spain's Foreign Minister Abel Matutes arrived on Monday in Algiers on a two-day visit to discuss cooperation between the two countries, said Algerian state-run radio.

The two Mediterranean countries had about $2 billion two-way trade in 1995. Algeria imported products from Spain for $1.0 billion while Madrid bought mainly gas and oil worth $976 million from Algeria, according to official figures.

Trade is expected to soar shortly when a pipeline with an annual capacity of 9.5 billion cubic metres carrying gas from southern Algeria to Spain through Morocco starts commercial operations in November.
